title: What was the first canned food in history? - Quora

response.answer_text: Canning, method of preserving food from spoilage by storing it in containers that are hermetically sealed and then sterilized by heat. The process was invented after prolonged research by Nicolas Appert of France in 1809, in response to a call by his government for a means of preserving food for army and navy use.
If you mean in actual cans (and not preserved foods in earthenware or glass), it would be no earlier than 1810, because they didn’t exist before then.
I would suggest that canning started with bottled broth in champagne bottles that Napoleon had his scientists invent to store provisions on his way to Russia. The tinned cannisters followed after.
